question_sentence: The most important celebrity news trivia of the week: What color did Billie Eilish dye her hair?
On Tuesday, eight people in Georgia were shot, six of them Asian women. A sheriff's spokesperson caused controversy over which comment?
choices: He said the shooter was having a “bad day.”
He misattributed the number of women dead.
He said the shooter was “a quiet person, and it was  unexpected he would do this.”
He said he didn’t blame the shooter, who had a  sex addiction.

question_sentence: According to Stop AAPI Hate, there were ____ anti-Asian hate crimes from February 2020 to March 2021 – which is likely an undercount.
While officials confirm it's safe, concerns over the AstraZeneca vaccine came after reports of what health issue?
Xavier Becerra was confirmed as the first Latino Secretary of Health and Human Services. What was his previous position?
choices: Deputy Secretary of Health and Human Services
Transportation Cabinet Member under Mayor Eric Garcetti

question_sentence: Tiger Woods was discharged from the hospital after his car crash and is recovering from ‘serious leg injuries’ at home. Where is home for him?
The IRS has moved its tax deadline (again) from April 15 to what date?
Gov. Kay Ivey issued an emergency weather warning for what state after severe tornadoes struck the Southeast?
Prince Philip, the husband of Queen Elizabeth II, was discharged from the hospital this week after being admitted on Feb. 16. Why was he there?
choices: He fell at Buckingham Palace and fractured his tibia
To be treated for an infection and a heart procedure
After mental stress relating to Harry and Meghan’s  break from the royal family

question_sentence: It’s pandemic-era awards season! The Grammys happened this past Sunday. Who took home the coveted award for Album of The Year?
The government of which European country gave the green light this week for a trial of a four-day working week?
Beyonce has become the most-awarded woman in Grammys history after her wins at this year’s ceremony took her total tally of gongs to how much?
Which European country was the first to halt the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca jab amid unproven safety concerns?
What is the maximum sentence for defacing statues under the government’s new Police, Crime and Sentencing Bill?
The resignation of scandal-hit Labour MP Mike Hill has triggered a by-election in which constituency?
Brits are planning to spend a total of how much on holidays, eating out and shopping in a post-lockdown spree, according to new research?
Which high-street chain this week announced that its remaining stores will not reopen after lockdown restrictions are lifted?
The creative chief of the Tokyo Olympic Games has resigned after suggesting that a plus-sized female comedian should feature in the opening ceremony wearing what?
New research has found that what breed of whales taught each other how to avoid 19th century hunters?
The government’s newly published defence and foreign policy review has been billed as the ‘most radical reassessment of Britain’s place in the world’ since when?
Administration of which specific Covid-19 vaccine was halted in multiple European countries following reports it was possibly linked to blood clots?
evidence: Spain, Germany, France and Italy were some of the latest counties to halt the rollout of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine. The European Medicines Agency has since come out reconfirming the vaccine’s safety and efficacy.

question_sentence: According to the American Red Cross, approximately what percentage of blood donations taken from unvaccinated people at the beginning of March contained Covid-19 antibodies?
evidence: The American Red Cross found that just over 20% of blood donations taken at the beginning of March contained Covid-19 antibodies – a percentage that has increased exponentially since the organization started tracking samples in June 2020.

question_sentence: A top official from which foreign adversary warned the US against “causing a stink” in its first interactions with the country?
evidence: Kim Yo Jong, the prominent sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, warned the Biden administration that “it had better refrain from causing a stink at its first step.” The statement came as the US and South Korea conduct scaled-down military drills.

question_sentence: What has the Vatican publicly come out against, saying that it “cannot be considered licit” and calling it a “sin?”
evidence: In a statement endorsed by Pope Francis, the Vatican publicly denounced same-sex unions, a move certain to widen the chasm between the church and millions of LGBTQ Catholics around the world.

question_sentence: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is taking on a new, totally made-up title. What is it?
evidence: Musk added the title of “Technoking of Tesla” as part of the electric car company’s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. He’s still keeping his standard title of CEO.

question_sentence: Authorities have grappled with the motive behind a mass shooting in the Atlanta area that left 8 people dead at a series of spas. What have they stopped short of calling the shooting spree?
evidence: Authorities refrained from initially calling the shootings hate crimes. Six of the eight victims were Asian, leading many to believe the attacks could have been racially motivated, especially as they came amid a spate of anti-Asian attacks in the US.

question_sentence: Elliot Page became the first transgender man to be featured on the cover of which national magazine?
evidence: Page, who came out as transgender last year, is the actor formerly known as Ellen and the first transgender man to grace the cover of Time magazine.

question_sentence: A recent study published in the journal Nature Communications explores the origins of life on Earth. What does it name as a possible component for life as we know it?
evidence: The study posits that lightning strikes may have been a major factor in the origin of life, a mechanism that could have released early Earth phosphorous – one of life’s key elements – trapped deep in minerals.

question_sentence: Despite the dire global effects of the coronavirus pandemic, which nation was once again named world’s happiest country in the World Happiness Report 2021?
evidence: According to the report, based on data from the Gallup World Poll, Finland was deemed the world’s happiest country for the fourth straight year.

question_sentence: An astronomer recently named 27 newly discovered celestial bodies after African American, Hispanic and Native American astronauts. What specifically were discovered?
evidence: Discovered by astronomer Marc W. Buie, the 27 asteroids were named in honor of African American, Hispanic and Native American astronauts, plus one cosmonaut to inspire the next generation.
